definitions: To remove (something) from a surface by drawing a sharp or hard object across it.
To rub something against a rough surface, often making an unpleasant sound.
To injure (your knee, hand, etc.) slightly by rubbing it against something rough.
To manage to achieve or collect something with difficulty.
examples: She had to scrape the mud off her boots.
The chair scraped against the wooden floor.
He fell and scraped his knee.
They managed to scrape together enough money for the trip.
